pullRequest.title: 1884761: Candlepin presents a different number of certificates for a consumer based on accept header (ENT-3127)
pullRequest.bodyText:
Changes  :-

Changes made to export content access certs for a consumer who's owner in SCA mode.
Added Spec test to verify it.

beforeCommit.message: 1884761: Exporting content access certs for a consumer (ENT-3127)

afterCommit.message: 1884761: Exporting content access certs for a consumer (ENT-3127)

beforeCommit.message: 1884761: Exporting content access certs for a consumer (ENT-3127)

afterCommit.message: 1884761: Exporting content access certs for a consumer (ENT-3127)

nodes.bodyText: You can use try-with-resources here to avoid having to close the writer manually.

No need to create another exporter. Original on can be refactored to accept Certificate which both EntitlementCertificate and ContentAccessCertificate implement.
Other thing is that it could open its own Writer since both exporters are writing to a file. That way we don't have to wrap it in try-with-resources on every use.

+
+import org.candlepin.model.ContentAccessCertificate;
+
+import java.io.IOException;
+import java.io.Writer;
+
+public class ContentAccessCertExporter {

nodes.bodyText: We don't have to to inject the exporter. It has no dependencies and arguments for the export are created here so we can just create a new instance when we need it for the export.
nodes.diffHunk:

         CdnExporter cdnExporter,

         SyncUtils syncUtils, ExportExtensionAdapter extensionAdapter,
-        ModelTranslator translator) {
+        ModelTranslator translator,
+        ContentAccessManager contentAccessManager,
+        ContentAccessCertExporter contentAccessCertExporter) {

nodes.bodyText: It would be great to add some tests for the getEntitlementExport. All of the current tests are testing the getFullExport.
